You are given four integers: $n$, $p$, $q$, and $r$. You are also given an array of $n$ integers, $a_1$, $a_2$, ..., $a_n$.

Find the maximum value of the expression $p \cdot a_i + q \cdot a_j + r \cdot a_k$ where $1 \le i \le j \le k \le n$.

You are given a list of numbers and three values. Find the largest possible sum you can get by multiplying each number in the list by one of the three values and adding the results together, where the multiplication must follow a specific order (first number multiplied by the first value, second number multiplied by the second value, and third number multiplied by the third value).
